abstract: An amateur sous-chef spends the day in the kitchen at Le Bernardin in New York, one of the most highly acclaimed and most expensive restaurants in the world.
snippet: An amateur sous-chef spends the day in the kitchen at Le Bernardin in New York, one of the most highly acclaimed and most expensive restaurants in the world.
lead_paragraph: I MARCHED across the white-tiled kitchen at Le Bernardin in a four-star frenzy, sweat soaking my borrowed white chef’s jacket. The heat coming off the two six-burner commercial stoves in the center island was 1,000 degrees. The wall clock showed 8:10 p.m. The restaurant was in the middle of its second dinner seating, and I had just been summoned to reinforce the entree line as a sous-chef in training.

headline.main: Seeking Perfection in the Kitchen of a 4-Star Restaurant
